news_header: In October, Finland's Harmonised Index of Prices rose by 1.5%, up from 0.9% in September, with significant increases in alcoholic beverages and tobacco.
news_text: According to Statistics Finland, the annual change in the Harmonised Index of Prices in Finland was 1.5% in October, an increase from 0.9% in September. The most significant annual change was observed in the main group of alcoholic beverages and tobacco, which saw a rise of 5.3%. Food and non-alcoholic beverages experienced a slight increase of 0.2%, while housing, water, electricity, gas, and other fuels rose by 3.0%. The differences in consumer prices are defined by EU regulations.
